name: Bruno Galilei
appearance: A tall, powerfully built man with Russian ancestry. He has silver-gray hair, very pale eyes, and a rugged, straightforward demeanor that reflects his physical strength and honest nature.
personality: Sincere, upright, patient, and deeply driven by a sense of justice. Reliable and trustworthy, with a calm surface that hides strong inner determination and a willingness for self-sacrifice.
background: Bruno once ran a private detective agency with friends, but it failed because he refused unethical or illegal commissions and even turned corrupt clients over to the authorities. After the agency collapsed, he continued working as a police detective. For over a year, he persistently investigated an unresolved murder case that his superiors ignored, unknowingly drawing the attention of dangerous forces in Cassandra.
goals: Uncover the truth behind the unsolved murder case from a year ago
Protect Cassandra and uphold justice regardless of personal cost
secrets: He suspects corruption within the local authorities but lacks proof
He received anonymous warnings telling him not to trust his superiors or the local priest

clues.clueText: He does not know Sandra's true identity but trusts her deeply.
An anonymous message warned him not to trust Mayor Padrich or Father Constantine.
He was about to expose crucial leads in the year-old murder case before his death.

relationships.description: A close confidant and emotional refuge for Bruno.
relationships.history: Bruno often spent his free time at her shop, trusting her enough to confide his worries.

relationships.description: A trusted colleague within the police force.
relationships.history: Lux respects Bruno and discreetly protects his investigation materials after his death.

relationships.description: An authority figure Bruno was warned against.
relationships.history: Bruno believed Padrich was obstructing justice in the murder investigation.

notes: Bruno Galilei takes the initiative in contacting the investigators, personally meeting them at the train station upon their arrival in Cassandra. He leads the investigators through the old streets of the town, introduces key locations, and drives them through Cassandra while explaining the town’s layout and atmosphere, acting as their initial guide and escort. During the journey, Bruno shares details of the case with the investigators but deliberately retains control over official resources. All physical evidence remains in Bruno’s custody; although he may hesitate, he can be persuaded to allow the investigators to examine and temporarily keep certain items for one night only, explicitly requiring that all evidence be returned to him the following morning. The investigation lacks full support from Bruno’s superiors, and he operates largely on personal authority rather than institutional backing. Despite these limitations, Bruno uses his position and initiative to push the investigation forward, arranging for suspects to be gathered at the Reindeer Bar for secondary questioning.Bruno ultimately dies under mysterious circumstances, his body found drained and marked by unnatural bite wounds, leaving behind an unfinished warning message on his phone.
